H2.text: Mammals are the group of organisms that includes about 6200 known species.

A4.text: The total number of known (living) amphibian species as of March 31, 2019, is exactly 8,000

A5.text: The number of known amphibian species is approximately 8,000, of which nearly 90% are frogs

A6.text: About 12,000 living species of reptiles are listed in the Reptile Database.

A7.text: represented by about 5,700 living species (excluding domesticated species).

A8.text: According to research published in the Journal of Mammalogy in 2018, the number of recognised mammal species is 6,495, including 96 recently extinct.

A9.text: There are 376â€“524 species of living primates, depending on which classification is used.
